alert.note: Alert for Menifee; Montgomery; Powell; Wolfe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 7:27AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Powell, southeastern Montgomery, southwestern Morgan, Menifee and Wolfe Counties through 815 AM EDT... At 727 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Fagan, or 7 miles northeast of Stanton, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Frenchburg and Natural Bridge S.P. around 735 AM EDT. Mariba, Red River Gorge, Koomer Ridge Campground, Jenson and Pine Ridge around 740 AM EDT. Wellington, Pomeroyton, Stoll and Denniston around 745 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Campton, Maytown, Valeria, Gosneyville, Ezel, Calaboose, Artville, Stillwater, Korea, Ebon, Murphyfork, Toliver, Hazel Green, Pekin, Trent, Omer, Landsaw, Baptist, Henry, Rexville, Demund, Nickell, Daysboro, Mize, Grassy Creek, Lower Gilmore, New Cummer, Gilmore, Payton, Lizzielane, Cannel City, Sellars, Stacy Fork, Panama, Adele, Helechawa, Greear, Malone, Lewis, Caney, Holliday, Well Station, Burg, Wheel Rim, Belknap, Gordon Ford, Burkhart and Cottle. THIS INCLUDES Bert T. Combs Mountain Parkway between mile markers 22 and 63. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
